means: （政治）阴谋小集团，（尤指政治上的）阴谋

sentence.Network_en: He had been chosen by a cabal of fellow senators.
sentence.Network_cn: 他已被一个由一些参议员同仁组成的小集团选中。

sentence.Network_en: He had been chosen by a secret government cabal.
sentence.Network_cn: 他已被一个秘密的政府阴谋集团选中。

sentence.Network_en: Instead of trying to develop into a mass party, FRELIMO remained a small tightly organized cabal.
sentence.Network_cn: FRELIMO没有试图发展成大的政党, 而一直是组织严密的小秘密集团.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting the cabbala): from French cabale, from medieval Latin cabala (see Cabbala)

encyclopedia.content: 《CABAL online》是韩国EST soft公司历时三年开发出来的，被业界誉为MMORPG2.0的跨时代网络游戏,傲视全球网游的顶级战斗快感一直受到广大媒体的关注和众多玩家的追捧。

entry.def: If you refer to a group of politicians or other people as a cabal, you are criticizing them because they meet and decide things secretly.

example.ex: He had been chosen by a cabal of fellow senators.
example.tran: 他已被一个由一些参议员同仁组成的小集团选中。

means.word_mean: 1. a clique (often secret) that seeks power usually through intrigue
2. a plot to carry out some harmful or illegal act (especially a political plot)
1. engage in plotting or enter into a conspiracy, swear together;

auth_sentence.content: Lean claims, is fomented by a small cabal of xenophobes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lean claims, is fomented by a small cabal of xenophobes.
